intro: Thellungiella pumila, commonly known as the desert cress, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It is a small annual herb with simple, alternate leaves and small white or yellow flowers. The plant is well adapted to harsh environments, exhibiting drought tolerance and efficient water use. Its genome has been studied for its potential in understanding plant stress responses and evolution. Thellungiella pumila is also of interest in agricultural research due to its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
